property.name: path.data
property.description: Path in local filesystem where data will be stored.It is possible to add more than one path with comma separated paths

property.name: allocated.memory
property.description: In order to avoid ES use swap, ES will reserve this memory always. Unit is in megabytes and only an integer value. As memory will be locked, you have to ensure machine has enough memory.

property.name: mlockall
property.description: ElasticSearch performs poorly when JVM starts swapping: you should ensure that it _never_ swaps. Enabling this property forces JVM to lock memory on start, but when ES is running with other services in same machine, this will make ES greedy with memory.

property.name: network.publish_host
property.description: The publish host is the single interface that the node advertises to other nodes in the cluster, so that those nodes can connect to it.

property.name: network.bind_host
property.description: This specifies which network interface(s) a node should bind to in order to listen for incoming requests. A node can bind to multiple interfaces, e.g. two network cards, or a site-local address and a local address. Defaults to network.host.

property.name: network.host
property.description: Selects network interface for connectivity, possible values are _[networkInterface]_, _local_, _site_, _global_, default: _site_
